TITLE: Setting up Audit Logging in C#
DESCRIPTION: This C# code snippet shows how to configure audit logging in the Admin UI project. It sets up the audit logging service, configures HTTP event data, and adds the audit sink for database logging.
SOURCE: https://github.com/skoruba/identityserver4.admin/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
services.AddAuditLogging(options => { options.Source = auditLoggingConfiguration.Source; })
                .AddDefaultHttpEventData(subjectOptions =>
                    {
                        subjectOptions.SubjectIdentifierClaim = auditLoggingConfiguration.SubjectIdentifierClaim;
                        subjectOptions.SubjectNameClaim = auditLoggingConfiguration.SubjectNameClaim;
                    },
                    actionOptions =>
                    {
                        actionOptions.IncludeFormVariables = auditLoggingConfiguration.IncludeFormVariables;
                    })
                .AddAuditSinks<DatabaseAuditEventLoggerSink<TAuditLog>>();

            // repository for library
            services.AddTransient<IAuditLoggingRepository<TAuditLog>, AuditLoggingRepository<TAuditLoggingDbContext, TAuditLog>>();

            // repository and service for admin
            services.AddTransient<IAuditLogRepository<TAuditLog>, AuditLogRepository<TAuditLoggingDbContext, TAuditLog>>();
            services.AddTransient<IAuditLogService, AuditLogService<TAuditLog>>();
```

TITLE: Configuring Serilog Logging in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the configuration for Serilog logging in JSON format. It sets up various sinks including Console, File, and MSSqlServer, along with log level settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/skoruba/identityserver4.admin/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "Serilog": {
    "MinimumLevel": {
      "Default": "Error",
      "Override": {
        "Skoruba": "Information"
      }
    },
    "WriteTo": [
      {
        "Name": "Console"
      },
      {
        "Name": "File",
        "Args": {
          "path": "log.txt",
          "rollingInterval": "Day"
        }
      },
      {
        "Name": "MSSqlServer",
        "Args": {
          "connectionString": "...",
          "tableName": "Log",
          "columnOptionsSection": {
            "addStandardColumns": ["LogEvent"],
            "removeStandardColumns": ["Properties"]
          }
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

TITLE: Configuring Certificate Settings in JSON for IdentityServer4 STS
DESCRIPTION: This JSON configuration snippet sets up the certificate settings for the IdentityServer4 STS (Security Token Service). It disables the temporary signing key, specifies the certificate store location, and enables the use of a signing certificate thumbprint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/skoruba/identityserver4.admin/blob/master/docs/Configure-Azure-Deploy.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```

    "UseTemporarySigningKeyForDevelopment": false,
    "CertificateStoreLocation": "CurrentUser",
    "CertificateValidOnly": false,
    "UseSigningCertificateThumbprint": true,
    "SigningCertificateThumbprint": "<enter here thumbprint from Azure>"
}
```

TITLE: Generating Self-Signed Certificates with MkCert
DESCRIPTION: Commands to generate self-signed certificates using MkCert for local HTTPS development. This includes creating a root certificate and domain-specific certificates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/skoruba/identityserver4.admin/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd shared/nginx/certs
mkcert --install
copy $env:LOCALAPPDATA\mkcert\rootCA.pem ./cacerts.pem
copy $env:LOCALAPPDATA\mkcert\rootCA.pem ./cacerts.crt

mkcert -cert-file skoruba.local.crt -key-file skoruba.local.key skoruba.local *.skoruba.local
mkcert -pkcs12 skoruba.local.pfx skoruba.local *.skoruba.local
```

TITLE: Generating PFX Certificate using OpenSSL
DESCRIPTION: These OpenSSL commands generate a private key, create a public certificate, and export both into a pfx file. This pfx certificate is used for signing tokens in the IdentityServer4 setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/skoruba/identityserver4.admin/blob/master/docs/Configure-Azure-Deploy.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
openssl genrsa 2048 > private.pem
openssl req -x509 -new -key private.pem -out public.pem
openssl pkcs12 -export -in public.pem -inkey private.pem -out mycert.pfx
```

TITLE: Installing .NET Core 3.1 SDK on Ubuntu 19.04
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install .NET Core 3.1 SDK on Ubuntu 19.04 using the package manager. This includes downloading the Microsoft package, installing it, and then installing the .NET Core SDK.
SOURCE: https://github.com/skoruba/identityserver4.admin/blob/master/docs/Configure-Ubuntu-PostgreSQL-Tutorial.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```

sudo dpkg -i packages-microsoft-prod.deb

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install apt-transport-https
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install dotnet-sdk-3.1
```
